meanings.definition: A unit of dry measure equal to 32 quarts.
meanings.sent1: I picked a bushel of apples from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested a bushel of corn from his fields.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to carry a whole bushel of nuts up the tree!
meanings.sent4: She had a bushel of ideas for the project.
meanings.sent5: The market was filled with the sweet scent of a bushel of ripe peaches.

meanings.sent1: He had a bushel of toys scattered across the room.
meanings.sent2: She had a bushel of chores to do before the party.
meanings.sent3: The clown juggled a bushel of colorful balloons at the circus.
meanings.sent4: The team scored a bushel of goals in the final match.
meanings.sent5: The library had a bushel of books waiting to be read by eager readers.
